text:
harlem River Bridges-- Willis Avenue Bridge: The Willis Avenue (Bronx) Bridge over the harlem River. It is also known as the First Avenue (Manhattan) Bridge. View 2 shows the First Avenue approach to the bridge.
View 1: George L. Belgue  August, 1930

view 2: P. L. Sperr  August, 1936
title: Bridges - Harlem River Bridges - Willis Avenue Bridge.

text:
harlem River Bridges-- Willis Avenue Bridge: The Willis Avenue (Bronx) Bridge over the harlem River. It is also known as the First Avenue (Manhattan) Bridge. View 2 shows the First Avenue approach to the bridge.

view 2: P. L. Sperr  August, 1936
title: Bridges - Harlem River Bridges - Willis Avenue Bridge.

text:
(1)
Harlem River, north from East 123rd Street, showing the shores of Manhattan (left) and the Bronx. Also shown is the Willis Ave. Bridge and anchorages under construction for the Triborough Bridge, at the foot of East 125th Street, Manhattan (left).
Fall 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a year earlier, and eliminating the view of the Bronx shore.
September 12, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as view 2.
September 12, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Harlem River - Manhattan - East 123rd Street.

title: Harlem River - Manhattan - East 123rd Street.

text:
Triboro Bridge: The Manhattan Approach and the northern end of the East River Drive under construction. The view is northward in Nos. 1 and 2, from a point east of Pleasant Ave., at East 122nd Street. No. 3 is in a southeastward direction from the Willis - First Ave. Bridge, across the Harlem River. Note in the background of this picture, the other span of this Bridge, that connects Ward's Island with Queens.
May 18, 1936
P.L. Sparr
title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge.
